intro: Geniostoma ramosii, commonly known as the ramose geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to the plant.
